intro: Cyphanthera tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly cyphanthera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, fluffy appearance. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers that are often clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are typically trifoliate, consisting of three small, rounded leaflets. Cyphanthera tomentosa is well adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy soils across the inland regions of Australia.
